summary: This bill, the October 7 Gold Medal Act, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to the American hostages and victims of the October 7, 2023, attacks in Israel. It recognizes their suffering and sacrifice. The bill outlines findings about the attacks, the hostages, and the release of American citizens. It mandates the Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange the presentation of the medal, with the Secretary of the Treasury responsible for its design and striking. It also addresses the creation and sale of duplicate bronze medals and specifies the medal's status as a national medal and numismatic item. The bill designates the Weitzman National Museum of American Jewish History as the place for display and research of the medal.
